repnme.cdata!:
Ghana - Additional Financing for the
            Community-Based Rural Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Additional Financing for
            the Community-Based Rural Development Project for Ghana were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible; Bank performance was
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: effective communication is
            the key to promoting development outcomes. Inject awareness
            of Natural resource management (NRM) at the community level
            by having natural resource department in the District
            Assembly's (DAs). Effective relationships among
            development partners and good donor collaboration and
            harmonization are paramount to the successful implementation
            of a decentralized project. Inexperience among rural banks
            and project staff with the lending promoted by the project,
            as well as the lack of business skills among clients, posed
            challenges for implementing component three. Decentralizing
            project management functions up to the zone and regional
            levels was very instrumental in ensuring smooth
            implementation of the project.

repnme.cdata!:
Ghana - Community-Based Rural Development
            Project : additional financing

abstracts.cdata!:
This project paper concerns additional
            financing for the Ghana Community Based Rural Development
            Project (CBRDP). The project development objective is to
            strengthen the capacity of rural communities to enhance
            their quality of life by improving their productive assets,
            rural infrastructure, and access to key support services
            from private and public sources. The additional credit will
            help finance the costs associated with scaling up of CBRDP
            to reconstruct public goods in the flood-affected regions of
            the north, and extend support for decentralized service
            provision through the financing of basic public
            infrastructure by local level government authorities for an
            additional sixteen months of project implementation. The
            additional credit will also support further capacity
            building in relation to the expansion and extension of
            public works activities, and in support of decentralization
            as envisioned under the original project. Finally, the
            additional credit will support incremental program
            management costs related to these activities and an
            extension of the project implementation period.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Ghana Community-Based Rural
            Development Project aims to strengthen the capacity of rural
            communities to enhance their quality of life by improving
            their productive assets, rural infrastructure and access to
            key support services from private and public sources There
            are five project components: (a) Institutional Strengthening
            and Capacity Building strengthens governance and functional
            capacities of the Ministry of Local Government and Rural
            Development, Regional Planning Coordinating Units, and
            District Planning Coordinating Units to deliver cost
            effective services to rural communities; (b) Infrastructure
            for Agricultural Development supports the provision of water
            for agriculture, rural transport infrastructure and
            post-harvest facilities to enhance farm and non farm rural
            activities; (c) Rural enterprise development establishes
            community owned and managed businesses and micro-enterprises
            to create avenues for skills development and job creation;
            (d) Infrastructure for Social and Human Development
            rehabilitates existing schools, construction of community
            health compounds and nutrition centers and potable water for
            communities to enhance well-being and reduce water borne
            diseases; and  (e) Community-based natural resource
            management builds the capacity of communities and district
            assemblies to enhance environmental governance and
            integrated management of land and water resources.
